text: It is better to be feared than loved, if you cannot be both.
author: Niccolò Machiavelli

text: He who has a why to live for can bear almost any how.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: The world is a dangerous place, not because of those who do evil, but because of those who look on and do nothing.
author: Chanakya

text: The end justifies the means.
author: Niccolò Machiavelli

text: That which does not kill us makes us stronger.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: A person should not be too honest. Straight trees are cut first and honest people are screwed first.
author: Chanakya

text: Men should be either treated generously or destroyed, because they take revenge for slight injuries - for heavy ones they cannot.
author: Niccolò Machiavelli

text: I'm not upset that you lied to me, I'm upset that from now on I can't believe you.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: Even if a snake is not poisonous, it should pretend to be venomous.
author: Chanakya

text: If an injury has to be done to a man it should be so severe that his vengeance need not be feared.
author: Niccolò Machiavelli

text: Whoever fights monsters should see to it that in the process he does not become a monster.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: A man's enemies have no place in his house.
author: Chanakya

text: Everyone sees what you appear to be, few experience what you really are.
author: Niccolò Machiavelli

text: You must have chaos within you to give birth to a dancing star.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: The biggest guru-mantra is: Never share your secrets with anybody. It will destroy you.
author: Chanakya

text: There is no avoiding war; it can only be postponed to the advantage of others.
author: Niccolò Machiavelli

text: The higher we soar, the smaller we appear to those who cannot fly.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: Never make friends with people who are above or below you in status. Such friendships will never give you any happiness.
author: Chanakya

text: The first method for estimating the intelligence of a ruler is to look at the men he has around him.
author: Niccolò Machiavelli

text: To live is to suffer, to survive is to find some meaning in the suffering.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: Before you begin any undertaking, plan carefully.
author: Chanakya

text: All men have the natural and inalienable right to hear what I have to say.
author: Niccolò Machiavelli

text: I assess the power of a will by how much resistance, pain, torture it endures and knows how to turn to its advantage.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: Learn from the mistakes of others. You can't live long enough to make them all yourself.
author: Chanakya

text: Never attempt to win by force what can be won by deception.
author: Niccolò Machiavelli

text: The doer alone learneth.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: Education is the best friend. An educated person is respected everywhere. Education beats the beauty and the youth.
author: Chanakya

text: Where the willingness is great, the difficulties cannot be great.
author: Niccolò Machiavelli

text: The individual has always had to struggle to keep from being overwhelmed by the tribe.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: Books are as useful to a stupid person as a mirror is useful to a blind person.
author: Chanakya

text: The promise given was a necessity of the past: the word broken is a necessity of the present.
author: Niccolò Machiavelli

text: No price is too high to pay for the privilege of owning yourself.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: As soon as the fear approaches near, attack and destroy it.
author: Chanakya

text: A prince never lacks legitimate reasons to break his promise.
author: Niccolò Machiavelli

text: The snake which cannot cast its skin has to die. As well the minds which are prevented from changing their opinions; they cease to be mind.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: Never put your trust in friends; learn how to use enemies.
author: Chanakya

text: Princes and governments are far more dangerous than other elements within society.
author: Niccolò Machiavelli

text: In individuals, insanity is rare; but in groups, parties, nations and epochs, it is the rule.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: He who is overly attached to his family members experiences fear and sorrow, for the root of all grief is attachment.
author: Chanakya

text: Men in general judge more from appearances than from reality. All men have eyes, but few have the gift of penetration.
author: Niccolò Machiavelli

text: The surest way to corrupt a youth is to instruct him to hold in higher esteem those who think alike than those who think differently.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: Do not reveal what you have thought upon doing, but by wise council keep it secret.
author: Chanakya

text: A sign of intelligence is an awareness of one's own ignorance.
author: Niccolò Machiavelli

text: The most common lie is that which one lies to himself; lying to others is relatively an exception.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: Once you start a working on something, don't be afraid of failure and don't abandon it. People who work sincerely are the happiest.
author: Chanakya

text: One change always leaves the way open for the establishment of others.
author: Niccolò Machiavelli

text: Without music, life would be a mistake.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: There is no better test of a man's integrity than his behavior when he is wrong.
author: Chanakya

text: There is nothing more difficult to take in hand, more perilous to conduct, or more uncertain in its success, than to take the lead in the introduction of a new order of things.
author: Niccolò Machiavelli

text: Thoughts are the shadows of our feelings - always darker, emptier and simpler.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: A man is great by deeds, not by birth.
author: Chanakya

text: Men rise from one ambition to another: first, they seek to secure themselves against attack, and then they attack others.
author: Niccolò Machiavelli

text: All truly great thoughts are conceived while walking.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: The fragrance of flowers spreads only in the direction of the wind. But the goodness of a person spreads in all directions.
author: Chanakya

text: It is double pleasure to deceive the deceiver.
author: Niccolò Machiavelli

text: The advantage of a bad memory is that one enjoys several times the same good things for the first time.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: Test a servant while in service, a relative in difficulty, a friend in adversity, and a wife in misfortune.
author: Chanakya

text: Politics have no relation to morals.
author: Niccolò Machiavelli

text: The essence of all beautiful art, all great art, is gratitude.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: The one who cannot restrain their anger will suffer direly.
author: Chanakya

text: He who becomes a Prince through the favor of the people should always keep on good terms with them; which it is easy for him to do, since all they ask is not to be oppressed.
author: Niccolò Machiavelli

text: The future influences the present just as much as the past.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: There is some self-interest behind every friendship. There is no friendship without self-interests. This is a bitter truth.
author: Chanakya

text: War should be the only study of a prince. He should consider peace only as a breathing-time, which gives him leisure to contrive, and furnishes as ability to execute, military plans.
author: Niccolò Machiavelli

text: When marrying, ask yourself this question: Do you believe that you will be able to converse well with this person into your old age?
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: God is not present in idols. Your feelings are your god. The soul is your temple.
author: Chanakya

text: Hatred is gained as much by good works as by evil.
author: Niccolò Machiavelli

text: Convictions are more dangerous enemies of truth than lies.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: He who is not a tiger in his walkout becomes a jackal in his home.
author: Chanakya

text: The wise man does at once what the fool does finally.
author: Niccolò Machiavelli

text: Morality is the herd-instinct in the individual.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: Drop the idea that attachment and love are one thing. They are enemies. It is attachment that destroys all love.
author: Chanakya

text: The more sand that has escaped from the hourglass of our life, the clearer we should see through it.
author: Niccolò Machiavelli

text: There are no facts, only interpretations.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: It's the lot of man to strive no matter how content he is.
author: Chanakya

text: The best fortress which a prince can possess is the affection of his people.
author: Niccolò Machiavelli

text: Sometimes people don't want to hear the truth because they don't want their illusions destroyed.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: There is poison in the fang of the serpent, in the mouth of the fly and in the sting of a scorpion; but the wicked man is saturated with it.
author: Chanakya

text: A return to first principles in a republic is sometimes caused by the simple virtues of one man.
author: Niccolò Machiavelli

text: When we are tired, we are attacked by ideas we conquered long ago.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: Wealth, a friend, a wife, and a kingdom may be regained, but this body when lost may never be acquired again.
author: Chanakya

text: One who deceives will always find those who allow themselves to be deceived.
author: Niccolò Machiavelli

text: A thought comes when it wishes, not when I wish.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: The life of an uneducated man is as useless as the tail of a dog which neither covers its rear end, nor protects it from the bites of insects.
author: Chanakya

text: Benefits should be conferred gradually; and in that way they will taste better.
author: Niccolò Machiavelli

text: The man of knowledge must be able not only to love his enemies but also to hate his friends.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: Do not be too honest. Honest people are straight trees cut first and the straight path a path of grief.
author: Chanakya

text: The wise man will make tools of what he has, rather than chide the heavens for not giving him what he wishes.
author: Niccolò Machiavelli

text: To forget one's purpose is the commonest form of stupidity.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: The biggest guru-mantra is: never share your secrets with anybody. It will destroy you.
author: Chanakya

text: I'm not interested in preserving the status quo; I want to overthrow it.
author: Niccolò Machiavelli

text: The lonely one offers his hand too quickly to whomever he encounters.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: We should never fret for what is past, nor should we be anxious about the future.
author: Chanakya

text: Of mankind we may say in general they are fickle, hypocritical, and greedy of gain.
author: Niccolò Machiavelli

text: A politician divides mankind into two classes: tools and enemies.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: As soon as the fear approaches near, attack and destroy it.
author: Chanakya

text: There is no surer sign of decay in a country than to see the rites of religion held in contempt.
author: Niccolò Machiavelli

text: Arrogance on the part of the meritorious is even more offensive to us than the arrogance of those without merit: for merit itself is offensive.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: The life of a single human being is worth a million times more than all the property of the richest man on earth.
author: Chanakya

text: The first method for estimating the intelligence of a ruler is to look at the men he has around him.
author: Niccolò Machiavelli

text: The strong do what they can, the weak accept what they must.
author: Thucydides

text: The powerful do what they can and the weak suffer what they must.
author: Thucydides

text: A truly great man will neither trample on a worm nor cringe before an emperor.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: If men were angels, no government would be necessary.
author: James Madison

text: I learned that courage was not the absence of fear, but the triumph over it.
author: Nelson Mandela

text: I must be cruel only to be kind.
author: William Shakespeare

text: Power is not a means, it is an end. One does not establish a dictatorship in order to safeguard a revolution; one makes the revolution in order to establish the dictatorship.
author: George Orwell

text: The worst form of inequality is to try to make unequal things equal.
author: Aristotle

text: The lion cannot protect himself from traps, and the fox cannot defend himself from wolves. One must therefore be a fox to recognize traps, and a lion to frighten wolves.
author: Niccolò Machiavelli

text: What doesn't destroy my enemies, makes them stronger.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: The axe forgets, but the tree remembers.
author: African Proverb

text: Those who cannot understand how to put their thoughts on ice should not enter into the heat of debate.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: When you are ready to serve the world, the world is not ready to be served. When the world is ready to be served, you are not ready to serve it.
author: Chanakya

text: You must be ready to burn yourself in your own flame; how could you rise anew if you have not first become ashes?
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: A kingdom that has once been destroyed can never come again into being; nor can the dead ever be brought back to life.
author: Sun Tzu

text: We are each our own devil, and we make this world our hell.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: If you know the enemy and know yourself, you need not fear the result of a hundred battles.
author: Sun Tzu

text: When one has not had a good father, one must create one.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: The weak can never forgive. Forgiveness is the attribute of the strong.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: The greatest hazard of all, losing one's self, can occur very quietly in the world, as if it were nothing at all.
author: Søren Kierkegaard

text: To win one hundred victories in one hundred battles is not the acme of skill. To subdue the enemy without fighting is the acme of skill.
author: Sun Tzu

text: When a man is denied the right to live the life he believes in, he has no choice but to become an outlaw.
author: Nelson Mandela

text: He who knows when he can fight and when he cannot will be victorious.
author: Sun Tzu

text: Remain silent about your intentions until they are realized.
author: Chanakya

text: When dealing with people, remember you are not dealing with creatures of logic, but with creatures bristling with prejudice and motivated by pride and vanity.
author: Dale Carnegie

text: In order to rise from its own ashes, a phoenix first must burn.
author: Octavia E. Butler

text: As iron sharpens iron, so one person sharpens another.
author: King Solomon

text: A king only bows down to his queen.
author: Anonymous

text: If you must break the law, do it to seize power: in all other cases observe it.
author: Julius Caesar

text: Do not look for approval except for the consciousness of doing your best.
author: Andrew Carnegie

text: I would rather be feared than loved if I cannot be both.
author: Al Capone

text: Victorious warriors win first and then go to war, while defeated warriors go to war first and then seek to win.
author: Sun Tzu

text: The tree of liberty must be refreshed from time to time with the blood of patriots and tyrants.
author: Thomas Jefferson

text: Power concedes nothing without a demand. It never did and it never will.
author: Frederick Douglass

text: There is nothing impossible to him who will try.
author: Alexander the Great

text: All war is deception.
author: Sun Tzu

text: The vision of the eagle is not so sharp as the vision of man, but the eagle can see where man cannot.
author: Native American Proverb

text: If you want to shine like the sun, first burn like the sun.
author: A.P.J. Abdul Kalam

text: He who loves the more is the inferior and must suffer.
author: Thomas Mann

text: The weak are always anxious for justice and equality. The strong pay no heed to either.
author: Aristotle

text: Appearance blinds, whereas words reveal.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Great achievements are usually born of great sacrifice, and are never the result of selfishness.
author: Napoleon Hill

text: You have enemies? Good. That means you've stood up for something, sometime in your life.
author: Winston Churchill

text: Let your plans be dark and impenetrable as night, and when you move, fall like a thunderbolt.
author: Sun Tzu

text: The world as we have created it is a process of our thinking. It cannot be changed without changing our thinking.
author: Albert Einstein

text: If your enemy is secure at all points, be prepared for him. If he is in superior strength, evade him. If your opponent is temperamental, seek to irritate him.
author: Sun Tzu

text: The man who moves a mountain begins by carrying away small stones.
author: Confucius

text: Silence is the ultimate weapon of power.
author: Charles de Gaulle

text: Do not pray for an easy life, pray for the strength to endure a difficult one.
author: Bruce Lee

text: The greatest victory is that which requires no battle.
author: Sun Tzu

text: I was ready to love the whole world, but no one understood me, and I learned to hate. My cheerless youth passed in conflict with myself and society, and fearing ridicule I buried my finest feelings deep in my heart, and there they died.
author: Mikhail Lermontov
